metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（混合林站自动气象站-2020）
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the Sidaoqiao mixed forest station from January 1 to December 31, 2020. The site (101.134° E, 41.990° N) was located on a tamarix and populous forest (Tamarix chinensis Lour. and Populus euphratica Olivier.) surface in the Sidaoqiao, Dalaihubu Town, Ejin Banner, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. The elevation is 874 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (28 m, north), wind speed and direction profile (28 m, north), air pressure (in tamper box), rain gauge (28 m, south), four-component radiometer (24 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (24 m, south, vertically downward), two photosynthetically active radiation (24 m, south, one vertically upward and one vertically downward), soil heat flux (HFP01; 3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6, -1.0, -1.6, -2.0, -2.4 m), and soil moisture profile (-0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6, -1.0, -1.6, -2.0, -2.4 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_28 m; RH_28 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_28 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_28 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_up and PAR_down) (μmol/ (s m^-2)), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2 and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_60 cm, Ts_100, Ts_160, Ts_200, Ts_240 cm) (℃), and soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_60 cm, Ms_100, Ms_160, Ms_200, Ms_240 cm) (%, volumetric water content).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. Due to the power loss, there were occasionally data missing in January. Due to the sensor malfunction, the wind direction and soil temperature at 240 cm depth during January to June and soil temperature at 10 cm depth were missing. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2020-9-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2020年1月1日至2020年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网下游混合林站气象要素观测数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗达来呼布镇四道桥，下垫面是胡杨与柽柳。观测点的经纬度是101.1335E,41.9903N，海拔874m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在28m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在28m处；风速与风向传感器架设在28m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在24m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；两个光合有效辐射仪安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm、100cm、160cm、200cm和240cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm、100cm、160cm、200cm和240cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_28m、RH_28m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_28m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_28m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm、Ts_160cm、Ts_200cm、Ts_240cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm、Ms_160cm、Ms_200cm、Ms_240cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_up、PAR_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示； 1.1-1.14由于供电问题，数据间断出现一些缺失；由于探头问题，风向和240cm土壤温度在上半年出现问题，10cm土壤温度在7-9月间断出现问题；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2020-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称
黑河综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区被先前的研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），阿拉尔海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，其中包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Verification.QuestionEn: Is there a publicly available dataset for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas?
Verification.QuestionCn: 是否有公开可用的数据集，用于观察绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Are the primary data collection methods for oasis–desert ecosystem studies based on field observations, remote sensing, or numerical simulations?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 研究绿洲-沙漠生态系统的主要数据收集方法是基于实地观察、遥感还是数值模拟？
Disjunctive.AnswerEn: field observations, remote sensing, numerical simulations
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 现场观测、遥感、数值模拟

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Which quality control measures are more commonly used in processing meteorological data: removing duplicate records, deleting data beyond physical significance, or both?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在气象数据处理过程中，哪些质量控制措施更常用：去除重复记录、删除超出物理意义的数据，还是两者都有？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What are the primary data collection methods used for observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的主要数据收集方法有哪些？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, automatic weather stations
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统、闪烁仪、自动气象站

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What challenges are faced by inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas that affect data collection for ecological studies?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域面临哪些挑战，这些挑战影响生态研究的数据收集？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a dataset that includes long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个数据集的示例，该数据集包括绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测数据？
Example.AnswerEn: A dataset that includes long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is available from the study area comprising the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) in western China. This dataset includes data from 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations established since 2012, capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes as well as hydrometeorological data.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个包含对绿洲-沙漠生态系统进行长期观察的能量、水汽和碳交换的数据集可用于研究区域，该区域包括中国西部的黑河流域中下游。该数据集包括自2012年以来建立的11个地表通量和气象站的数据，捕捉能量、水汽和碳通量以及水文气象数据。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a data collection method used to gather information on soil parameters in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区收集土壤参数信息的一种数据收集方法的例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a data collection method for gathering soil parameters in arid regions involves using automatic weather stations to observe soil temperature profiles and soil moisture profiles, as well as using soil heat flux plates. These parameters are typically measured at different depths to understand the soil's thermal and moisture conditions.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区收集土壤参数的一种数据收集方法是使用自动气象站观察土壤温度剖面和土壤湿度剖面，以及使用土壤热通量板。这些参数通常在不同深度进行测量，以了解土壤的热和湿条件。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a challenge faced in maintaining data quality for meteorological observations in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区维护气象观测数据质量时面临的一个挑战的例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge faced in maintaining data quality for meteorological observations in arid regions is the occurrence of data gaps due to power supply issues, as seen in the dataset from the Heihe River Basin where data from January 1-14 showed interruptions. Additionally, issues with sensors such as those measuring wind direction or soil temperature can also lead to data quality challenges.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区维护气象观测数据质量面临的一个挑战是由于电力供应问题导致的数据缺口，例如在黑河流域的数据集中，1月1日至14日的数据出现了中断。此外，测量风向或土壤温度等传感器的问题也可能导致数据质量挑战。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with data collection in inland river basins of arid and semi-arid areas?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域，数据收集面临哪些挑战？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: ecological environment degradation, drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, frequent dust storms
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 生态环境退化，河流和湖泊干涸，天然植被退化，土地荒漠化加剧，沙尘暴频发。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the properties of datasets that help understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 帮助理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据集的属性是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: long-term observations of energy fluxes, water vapor fluxes, carbon and methane fluxes, hydrometeorological data, vegetation parameters, soil parameters
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 长期观测能量通量、水汽通量、碳和甲烷通量、水文气象数据、植被参数、土壤参数

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many meteorological elements are observed at the mixed forest station in the Heihe River Basin comprehensive observation network in 2020?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 2020年黑河流域综合观测网络的混合森林站观测了多少气象要素？

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the frequency of data collection for meteorological observations at the automatic weather stations in the HRB oasis–desert systems?
Quantification.QuestionCn: HRB绿洲-沙漠系统中自动气象站的数据收集频率是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many land surface flux and meteorological stations are established in the middle and lower reaches of the HRB since 2012?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，HRB中下游地区建立了多少个地表通量和气象站？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'eddy covariance system' mean in the context of data collection for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在能量、水汽和碳交换的数据收集背景下，“涡度协方差系统”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of data collection for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, an 'eddy covariance system' refers to a method for measuring and calculating the turbulent fluxes of these components between the land surface and atmosphere. It involves using instruments that capture high-frequency wind and scalar data to compute the covariance between vertical wind speed and scalar quantities like CO2 concentration, thus enabling the study of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集背景下，“涡度协方差系统”指的是一种测量和计算地表与大气之间这些成分湍流通量的方法。它涉及使用能够捕捉高频风速和标量数据的仪器，以计算垂直风速与二氧化碳浓度等标量量之间的协方差，从而使研究能量、水蒸气和碳交换过程成为可能。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'comprehensive observation network' mean in the context of environmental data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在环境数据收集的背景下，“综合观测网络”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of environmental data collection, a 'comprehensive observation network' refers to a coordinated system of multiple observation sites and instruments designed to systematically monitor various environmental parameters such as meteorological, hydrological, and ecological data across a specific region. This network aims to provide integrated datasets that facilitate the understanding of complex environmental processes and interactions.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在环境数据收集的背景下，“综合观测网络”指的是一个协调的系统，由多个观测站和仪器组成，旨在系统地监测特定区域内的各种环境参数，如气象、水文和生态数据。该网络旨在提供集成的数据集，以促进对复杂环境过程和相互作用的理解。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection techniques used at the Heihe River Basin meteorological stations compare to those used in other oasis-desert systems with respect to measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域气象站使用的数据收集技术与其他绿洲-沙漠系统在测量能量、水汽和碳交换方面的比较如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the Heihe River Basin, data collection involves automatic weather stations measuring meteorological parameters with 10-minute averages, similar to other oasis-desert systems where hydrometeorological data, including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, are collected. However, the specific setup, such as the use of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers in some studies, may vary.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在黑河流域，数据收集涉及自动气象站测量气象参数，采用10分钟平均值，这与其他绿洲-沙漠系统相似，这些系统收集水文气象数据，包括能量、水汽和碳通量。然而，具体的设置可能有所不同，例如在一些研究中使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways could long-term observational data from automated weather stations contribute to understanding the ecological and socioeconomic dynamics of oasis-desert systems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据来自自动气象站可以通过哪些方式帮助理解绿洲-沙漠系统的生态和社会经济动态？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Long-term observational data from automated weather stations can provide critical insights into the ecological balance and sustainability of oasis-desert systems by capturing trends in energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges. This understanding can inform strategies for achieving carbon neutrality and ecological security, which are vital for the socioeconomic development of these regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 来自自动气象站的长期观测数据可以为绿洲-沙漠系统的生态平衡和可持续性提供重要的见解，通过捕捉能量、水蒸气和碳交换的趋势。这种理解可以为实现碳中和和生态安全的策略提供信息，这对这些地区的社会经济发展至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in maintaining data quality and accuracy in meteorological observations in arid oasis–desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱绿洲-沙漠系统中，维护气象观测数据质量和准确性面临的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining data quality and accuracy in meteorological observations in arid oasis–desert systems can be caused by issues such as power supply interruptions, sensor malfunctions, and environmental factors that lead to data gaps or inconsistencies. Specifically, problems with wind direction sensors and soil temperature sensors have been noted, which can impact the reliability of the collected data.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱绿洲-沙漠系统中，维护气象观测数据质量和准确性面临的挑战可能由以下问题引起：电源中断、传感器故障以及导致数据缺失或不一致的环境因素。具体而言，风向传感器和土壤温度传感器的问题已被注意到，这可能影响所收集数据的可靠性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is long-term observation considered indispensable for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 长期观察被认为是理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换不可或缺的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Long-term observation is considered indispensable for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems because it provides a comprehensive understanding of the basic characteristics and interactions within these systems. This understanding is crucial to achieving sustainable oasis development and supporting ecological security, particularly in the context of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality goals.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 长期观察被认为是理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换不可或缺的，因为它提供了对这些系统基本特征和相互作用的全面理解。这种理解对于实现可持续的绿洲发展和支持生态安全至关重要，特别是在碳达峰和碳中和目标的背景下。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the need for extensive soil and vegetation parameter datasets in oasis–desert research?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠研究中，哪些因素促使对广泛的土壤和植被参数数据集的需求？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The need for extensive soil and vegetation parameter datasets in oasis–desert research is driven by the requirement to accurately quantify the interactions between the environment and these parameters. These datasets are crucial in understanding the dynamics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which are vital for maintaining ecological stability and supporting socioeconomic development in such regions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠研究中，对广泛的土壤和植被参数数据集的需求源于准确量化环境与这些参数之间相互作用的要求。这些数据集对于理解能量、水蒸气和碳交换的动态至关重要，这对维持生态稳定和支持这些地区的社会经济发展至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers in data collection for oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中进行数据收集的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: These tools allow for the acquisition of half-hourly turbulent flux data, providing critical insights into the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis–desert areas, which are essential for understanding interactions and sustainability in these ecosystems.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 这些工具允许获取半小时的湍流通量数据，为理解绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换提供了关键的见解，这对于理解这些生态系统的相互作用和可持续性至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications of long-term observations in oasis–desert areas for addressing environmental degradation challenges in arid and semiarid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区的长期观察对解决干旱和半干旱地区环境退化挑战的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are indispensable for maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems, helping to mitigate crises such as land desertification and dust storms, and supporting the sustainable development of these critical ecological landscapes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 长期观察对于维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要，有助于缓解土地沙漠化和沙尘暴等危机，并支持这些关键生态景观的可持续发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it crucial to understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems within the context of global climate change?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换在全球气候变化背景下至关重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind establishing long-term observational datasets for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in arid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 建立干旱地区能源、水汽和碳交换的长期观测数据集的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are implemented to ensure data quality and control when observing meteorological elements at an automatic weather station in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区的自动气象站观察气象要素时，实施了哪些程序以确保数据质量和控制？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The procedures for ensuring data quality and control include ensuring the collection of 144 data points per day, marking missing data with -6999, removing duplicate records, deleting data that exceed physical or instrument limits, marking questionable data in red, and standardizing the date and time format.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 确保数据质量和控制的程序包括每天收集144个数据点，用-6999标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超过物理或仪器限制的数据，用红色标记可疑数据，以及标准化日期和时间格式。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What data collection methods are used to observe energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, and how are these observations integrated into a comprehensive dataset?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，观察能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法有哪些？这些观察结果是如何整合成一个综合数据集的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data collection methods used include the use of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for flux measurements, and automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data with a 10-minute average period. These observations are integrated into a comprehensive dataset by combining energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data with auxiliary data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, and applying a structured data processing, quality control, and archiving procedure.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪进行通量测量，以及使用自动气象站收集具有10分钟平均周期的水文气象数据。这些观测数据通过将能量、水蒸气和碳通量数据与辅助的水文气象、植被和土壤参数数据结合，经过结构化的数据处理、质量控制和归档程序，整合成一个综合数据集。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methods enable the comprehensive monitoring of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集方法能够全面监测绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The data collection methods include the use of an eddy covariance system, scintillometer, and automatic weather stations to acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data and hydrometeorological data with a 10-minute average period. These methods provide detailed observations involving radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature, humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站，以获取半小时的湍流通量数据和10分钟平均的水文气象数据。这些方法提供了详细的观测数据，包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度、湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do specific observational setups, such as sensor placement and calibration, enable accurate data acquisition in arid and semiarid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 特定的观测设置，例如传感器的放置和校准，如何在干旱和半干旱地区实现准确的数据采集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: In the mixed forest station of the Heihe River Basin, sensors for air temperature and relative humidity are mounted at 28m, while wind sensors and tipping bucket rain gauges are positioned similarly to ensure consistent data capture. Soil temperature and moisture sensors are strategically buried at various depths to accurately profile subsurface conditions, enhancing the reliability and accuracy of the data collected.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在黑河流域的混合森林站，空气温度和相对湿度传感器安装在28米高的位置，同时风速传感器和翻斗雨量计也以相似的高度布置，以确保数据捕获的一致性。土壤温度和湿度传感器则被战略性地埋设在不同深度，以准确描绘地下条件，从而提高所收集数据的可靠性和准确性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological and methodological advancements are crucial for maintaining long-term ecological monitoring in the context of oasis–desert interactions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠相互作用的背景下，维持长期生态监测所需的关键技术和方法论进展是什么？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Long-term ecological monitoring is supported by advanced technologies such as automatic weather stations, which provide continuous hydrometeorological data collection, and the integration of auxiliary data on vegetation and soil parameters. The use of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for energy, water vapor, and carbon flux measurements is also crucial, along with data processing, quality control, and data archiving techniques to ensure data accuracy and availability.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 长期生态监测得益于先进技术的支持，例如自动气象站，这些站点提供连续的水文气象数据收集，并整合了关于植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪进行能量、水蒸气和碳通量测量也至关重要，同时数据处理、质量控制和数据归档技术确保了数据的准确性和可用性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the data collection methods for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems need to incorporate multiple observational datasets and auxiliary data?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法为何需要结合多个观测数据集和辅助数据？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is crucial to maintaining the balance between these systems and supporting ecological security. A comprehensive suite of observational datasets, including hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, provides a quantitative understanding that is significant for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and protecting ecological stability.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征对于维持这些系统之间的平衡和支持生态安全至关重要。包括水文气象、植被和土壤参数在内的全面观测数据集提供了定量理解，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用和保护生态稳定性具有重要意义。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in maintaining a consistent and accurate dataset of meteorological observations in arid and semiarid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，维护一致和准确的气象观测数据集可能会面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological degradation challenges such as river drying, vegetation degradation, and intensified land desertification, which can affect data consistency and accuracy. Observational data may experience issues like missing or erroneous data due to environmental conditions, instrument malfunctions, or data transmission failures.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态退化的挑战，如河流干涸、植被退化和加剧的土地沙漠化，这可能影响数据的一致性和准确性。观测数据可能由于环境条件、仪器故障或数据传输失败而出现缺失或错误的数据问题。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it important for datasets covering oasis–desert areas to undergo rigorous data processing and quality control procedures?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 覆盖绿洲-沙漠地区的数据集进行严格的数据处理和质量控制程序的重要性是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Rigorous data processing and quality control are essential to ensure the dataset's reliability and accuracy, especially given the critical role these datasets play in understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange for maintaining ecological stability and supporting socio-economic development in oasis–desert areas. This involves removing duplicate records, correcting erroneous data, and ensuring consistent data formatting.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 严格的数据处理和质量控制对于确保数据集的可靠性和准确性至关重要，特别是考虑到这些数据集在理解能量、水汽和碳交换方面所发挥的关键作用，以维护生态稳定并支持绿洲-沙漠地区的社会经济发展。这包括删除重复记录、纠正错误数据以及确保数据格式的一致性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of using automated weather stations and eddy covariance systems for collecting comprehensive data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估使用自动气象站和涡度协方差系统在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集能量、水蒸气和碳交换的综合数据的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of automated weather stations and eddy covariance systems appears effective for collecting comprehensive data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, as they provide detailed hydrometeorological data and turbulent fluxes essential for understanding oasis–desert interactions. These methods allow for continuous long-term observations, which are crucial for evaluating ecological stability and socioeconomic development in these regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 自动气象站和涡度协方差系统的使用似乎有效地收集了关于能量、水蒸气和碳交换的综合数据，因为它们提供了详细的水文气象数据和湍流通量，这对于理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用至关重要。这些方法允许进行连续的长期观测，这对于评估这些地区的生态稳定性和社会经济发展至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how a dataset in the context of oasis–desert systems can effectively measure and balance energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在绿洲-沙漠系统的背景下，数据集如何有效地测量和平衡能量、水蒸气和碳的交换。
Assertion.AnswerEn: A dataset in the context of oasis–desert systems can effectively measure and balance energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges by using long-term observational data, such as those from artificial and natural systems, capturing fluxes and auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. The use of an eddy covariance system and scintillometer for acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data, along with hydrometeorological observations from automatic weather stations, enables comprehensive monitoring and analysis of these exchanges.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的背景下，数据集可以有效地测量和平衡能量、水汽和碳的交换，使用长期观测数据，例如来自人工和自然系统的数据，捕捉通量和涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据，以及来自自动气象站的水文气象观测，可以全面监测和分析这些交换。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how data collection methods ensure the accuracy of soil moisture profiles and temperature gradients in arid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解数据收集方法如何确保干旱地区土壤湿度剖面和温度梯度的准确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data collection methods ensure the accuracy of soil moisture profiles and temperature gradients in arid regions by using automatic weather stations that observe hydrometeorological data with a 10-minute average period. This includes measurements of radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, and gradients of air temperature and humidity, which are complemented by the deployment of sensors at various soil depths and precise data processing and quality control procedures.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法通过使用自动气象站观察水文气象数据，以10分钟的平均周期确保干旱地区土壤湿度剖面和温度梯度的准确性。这包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面以及空气温度和湿度梯度的测量，此外还通过在不同土壤深度部署传感器以及精确的数据处理和质量控制程序进行补充。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and discuss the challenges faced in data collection for inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas, focusing on ecological environment degradation.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别并讨论在干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域数据收集面临的挑战，重点关注生态环境退化。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in data collection for inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas include ecological degradation issues such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These challenges are exacerbated in many inland river basins along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin, the Aral Sea basin, and the Lake Urmia basin. Accurate data collection is crucial to address these issues and support sustainable development in these regions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，内陆河流流域的数据收集面临的挑战包括生态退化问题，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些挑战在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域中更加严重，例如塔里木河流域、阿拉尔海流域和乌尔米耶湖流域。准确的数据收集对于解决这些问题和支持这些地区的可持续发展至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential datasets and their significance for studying the balance between oasis and desert systems to achieve sustainable development goals.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探索潜在的数据集及其在研究绿洲与沙漠系统之间平衡以实现可持续发展目标方面的重要性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets for studying the balance between oasis and desert systems include those containing observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, as well as auxiliary data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. These datasets, available from sources like the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center, are significant for understanding ecosystem interactions, supporting ecological security, and achieving sustainable development goals by providing critical insights into the dynamics of oasis-desert systems.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 研究绿洲与沙漠系统之间平衡的潜在数据集包括包含能量、水蒸气和碳交换观测的数据，以及关于水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。这些数据集可从国家西藏高原数据中心等来源获取，对于理解生态系统相互作用、支持生态安全以及实现可持续发展目标具有重要意义，因为它们提供了关于绿洲-沙漠系统动态的关键见解。
